comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: I heard the implement described in several different ways, as a hay knife, a hedge knife, a pruning knife and a billhook.  The slashook was more curved, had a longer handle and was a more fearsome implement when used in a row.  A billhook was actually a medieval weapon related to the poleaxe and mounted on a long handle could be used to chop at enemies from 8 to 10 feet away.  Not a nice way to have ones hair parted early in the morning.  Nice shot of two rustic looking characters.

comment.author: 29812917@N03
comment._content: The building they are standing against is tthe Photographic House in Clonbrock - original home to The Clonbrock Collection. This small building still stands today as in my image www.flickr.com/photos/29812917@N03/6071359930/in/photostream
